meanings.definition: Characterized by sudden or unexpected changes
meanings.sent1: The storm was abrupter than we anticipated, catching us off guard.
meanings.sent2: Her abrupter decision to leave the party surprised everyone.
meanings.sent3: The abrupter weather changes made the picnic a chaotic adventure.
meanings.sent4: The abrupter shifts in his mood were like a rollercoaster ride.
meanings.sent5: The abrupter shifts in temperature made it hard to dress appropriately.

meanings.definition: Someone or something that causes sudden or unexpected changes
meanings.sent1: The new manager was an abrupter in the office, shaking things up.
meanings.sent2: The arrival of the package was the abrupter of our peaceful evening.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy was the abrupter of calm in the house.
meanings.sent4: The magician was an abrupter of reality, making the audience gasp.
meanings.sent5: The unexpected guest was the abrupter of the quiet family dinner.

meanings.definition: To make something sudden or unexpected
meanings.sent1: She decided to abruptly change her hair color, abruptlying her appearance.
meanings.sent2: The magician abruptlyed the rabbit out of the hat, surprising the audience.
meanings.sent3: He abruptlyed the meeting by announcing a surprise team-building activity.
meanings.sent4: The chef abruptlyed the dish with a unique ingredient, delighting the diners.
meanings.sent5: The thunderstorm abruptlyed our plans for a picnic in the park.
